member.name: T:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.CleanupMethod
member.summary: The CleanupMethod enum must strictly follow the following format: 0 = RowAgeOrRowCount, 1 = RowAgeAndRowCount, 1 = RowAge, 2 = RowCount.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.CleanupMethod.RowAgeOrRowCount
member.summary: Combo cleanup method uses both row age and row count to filter and clean the table.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.CleanupMethod.RowAgeAndRowCount
member.summary: Combo cleanup method uses both row age and row count to filter and clean the table.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.CleanupMethod.RowAge
member.summary: RowAge cleanup method will filter and clean rows based on how old they are.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.CleanupMethod.RowCount
member.summary: RowCount cleanup method will filter and clean the oldest rows once the table reaches a threshold capacity.

member.name: T:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.CleanupRow
member.summary: This references a generic row that has to be cleaned up. It contains a primary key and a time stamp.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.CleanupRow.PrimaryKey
member.summary: The primary key of a given row.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.CleanupRow.Timestamp
member.summary: The time stamp of a given row.

member.name: T:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.IFilter`1
member.summary: An interface for the filters to be implemented to clean and filter the table.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.IFilter`1.RemovedPrimaryKeys
member.summary: Contains the primary keys that are removed by the cleaning and filtering methods from the table.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.IFilter`1.Execute(Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.TableCleanupData)
member.summary: The execution of the filtering and cleaning on the table.
member.param: The cleanup data that has to be cleaned by the filters.
member.returns: The cleanup data after if has been cleaned and filtered by the filters.

member.name: T:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.MaximumAgeFilter
member.summary: The maximum age of the rows allowed on the table that implements the IFilter interface.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.MaximumAgeFilter.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: The maximum age allowed by the filter that cleans all rows with timestamps older than the given seconds provided.
member.param: The threshold age allowed of the oldest rows given in seconds.
The amount of rows that have to be deleted.
member.exception: An exception thrown if the threshold time is invalid.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.MaximumAgeFilter.RemovedPrimaryKeys
member.summary: The primary keys deleted and taken out of the table after filtering.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.MaximumAgeFilter.DeletionAmount
member.summary: The parameter setting the number of rows to be deleted when the table reaches its max capacity.

member.name: T:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.MaximumRowCountFilter
member.summary: The maximum row count allowed on the table that implements the IFilter interface.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.MaximumRowCountFilter.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: The constructor class for the MaximumRowCountFilter.
member.param: The max rows that should be allowed for the table.
The number of rows to be deleted when the table reaches its max capacity.
member.exception: Exception thrown if the given parameters are invalid.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.MaximumRowCountFilter.DeletionAmount
member.summary: The parameter setting the number of rows to be deleted when the table reaches its max capacity.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.MaximumRowCountFilter.MaxRowCount
member.summary: The parameter setting the max rows that should be allowed for the table.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.MaximumRowCountFilter.RemovedPrimaryKeys
member.summary: The parameter with the collection of primary keys of the rows that are removed from the table.

member.name: T:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.TableCleanupData
member.summary: The class containing the row data that needs to be cleaned and filtered.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.TableCleanupData.#ctor(Skyline.DataMiner.Scripting.SLProtocol,System.Int32)
member.summary: This constructor can be used if you only want to cleanup on row count.
member.param: This is SLProtocol which is used to manipulate table data.
This is the table that will be manipulated.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.TableCleanupData.Keys
member.summary: The keys of the rows that are remaining in the table after being filtered.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.TableCleanupData.Timestamps
member.summary: The timestamps of the rows that need to be referenced when filtering by the age of the rows.

member.name: T:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.TableFilters
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TableFilters class that contains the filters to apply to the TableData class.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.TableFilters.Filters
member.summary: These Filters are to be used on the TableData class and can be either of CleanupMethod NA, Combo, RowAge or RowCount.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.TableFilters.DeleteFilteredTable(Skyline.DataMiner.Scripting.SLProtocol,Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.TableCleanupData)
member.summary: This will clean the table based on the filters provided on the provided tablePid in the protocol.
member.param: The SLProtocol process that is running the delete function
Takes in CleanupData that will be filtered by the Filters initialized by the Builder class
